content:
Check:
  all:
    - name: --DY
      operator: non_empty
    - any:
        - name: --DTC
          operator: is_incomplete_date
        - name: RFSTDTC
          operator: is_incomplete_date
Core:
  Id: CDISC.SDTMIG.CG0007
  Version: '1'
  Status: Draft
Description: Raise an error when the date portion of --DTC is an incomplete date and
  the date portion of DM.RFSTDTC is an incomplete date, but --DY is not empty
Match Datasets:
  - Name: DM
    Keys:
      - USUBJID
Outcome:
  Message: The date portion of --DTC is not complete date or the date portion of DM.RFSTDTC
    is not complete date, but --DY is not empty
  Output Variables:
    - --DY
    - --DTC
    - RFSTDTC
Rule Type: Record Data
Sensitivity: Record
Authorities:
  - Organization: CDISC
    Standards:
      - Name: SDTMIG
        Version: '3.4'
        References:
          - Origin: SDTM and SDTMIG Conformance Rules
            Rule Identifier:
              Id: CG0007
              Version: '1'
            Version: '2.0'
            Citations:
              - Cited Guidance: The permissible Study Day variables (--DY, --STDY,
                  and --ENDY) . . . are determined by comparing the date portion of
                  the respective date/time variables (--DTC, --STDTC, and --ENDTC)
                  to the date portion of the Subject Reference Start Date (RFSTDTC
                  from the Demographics domain)
                Document: SDTMIG v3.4
                Section: 4.4.4
      - Name: SDTMIG
        Version: '3.3'
        References:
          - Origin: SDTM and SDTMIG Conformance Rules
            Rule Identifier:
              Id: CG0007
              Version: '1'
            Version: '2.0'
            Citations:
              - Cited Guidance: The permissible Study Day variables (--DY, --STDY,
                  and --ENDY) . . . are determined by comparing the date portion of
                  the respective date/time variables (--DTC, --STDTC, and --ENDTC)
                  to the date portion of the Subject Reference Start Date (RFSTDTC
                  from the Demographics domain).
                Document: SDTMIG v3.3
                Section: 4.4.4
      - Name: SDTMIG
        Version: '3.2'
        References:
          - Origin: SDTM and SDTMIG Conformance Rules
            Rule Identifier:
              Id: CG0007
              Version: '1'
            Version: '2.0'
            Citations:
              - Cited Guidance: The permissible Study Day variables (--DY, --STDY,
                  and --ENDY) . . . are determined by comparing the date portion of
                  the respective date/time variables (--DTC, --STDTC, and --ENDTC)
                  to the date portion of the Subject Reference Start Date (RFSTDTC
                  from the Demographics domain).
                Document: SDTMIG v3.2
                Section: 4.1.4.4
Scope:
  Classes:
    Include:
      - ALL
  Domains:
    Include:
      - ALL

json.Description: Raise an error when the date portion of --DTC is an incomplete date and the date portion of DM.RFSTDTC is an incomplete date, but --DY is not empty

Outcome.Message: The date portion of --DTC is not complete date or the date portion of DM.RFSTDTC is not complete date, but --DY is not empty

Citations.Cited_Guidance: The permissible Study Day variables (--DY, --STDY, and --ENDY) . . . are determined by comparing the date portion of the respective date/time variables (--DTC, --STDTC, and --ENDTC) to the date portion of the Subject Reference Start Date (RFSTDTC from the Demographics domain)

The permissible Study Day variables (--DY, --STDY, and --ENDY) . . . are determined by comparing the date portion of the respective date/time variables (--DTC, --STDTC, and --ENDTC) to the date portion of the Subject Reference Start Date (RFSTDTC from the Demographics domain).

The permissible Study Day variables (--DY, --STDY, and --ENDY) . . . are determined by comparing the date portion of the respective date/time variables (--DTC, --STDTC, and --ENDTC) to the date portion of the Subject Reference Start Date (RFSTDTC from the Demographics domain).
